reviews.review_msg:
Unclear course criteria, very disorganized, un-invested in their students' learning outcomes. 
If you are studying history you may do well in their courses. They care much more about formatting, technicalities, and due dates than they do about learning course content.

You either love her or you don't. I don't. She is extremely unorganized (proof showed through her messy office as well), constantly puts last minute assignments on us, expects us to be available for weekend events (as if we don't already have insane amounts of readings each week or other classes), and is unclear about what she really expects.

Great prof who knows her stuff. She's passionate and the discussions in her classes are fantastic. Main problem I've had is that she uses Canvas a lot. This is a problem because she isn't very tech savvy. She didn't find my final essay until I reminded her and before that she said that I didn't hand it in and didn't bother to check.

Dr. Chenier was a great prof. Opened my mind to new ideas through in-class discussions and readings. However, be prepared to do A LOT of reading to do well in the class. Also, marking scheme was a little ambiguous. If you agree with her line of thinking great, you'll do well. If not, you might have a problem and she does not give great feedback.
Amazing prof. Expect lots of effort to get a decent mark, but it's totally worth it! This course may even help you become a better person at the end of it. Don't take it if you're a slacker.
Elise is a great and fun teacher. Yes, it does require effort, but it was well worth it. Her class and material were life changing and fascinating.

Elise is unaware that anything else may be occurring in a students life other than her course.  Her assignments are unclear and after failing 80% of the class on one assignment did not take responsibility that it might be her teaching methods.  Pretends to be approachable - don't fall for it.

There were 13 classes in the semester and Bidisha cancelled SIX of them. Once she cancelled a class shortly  before it was about to start, when really she was "in a car accident" the day before and could have cancelled it then (as she did for her other class). She is inconsiderate and I want my money back. I would never take a class with her again.
